name: Idiopathic Tracheobronchial Amyloidosis
chief_complaint: I can't breathe properly and I keep wheezing
treatment: localized tracheal resection with end-to-end anastomosis
prognosis: Guarded with progressive airway compromise likely without intervention; 5-year survival ~60% with treatment
description: A rare form of localized amyloid deposition in the tracheobronchial tree causing progressive airway obstruction. Characterized by extracellular deposition of misfolded amyloid proteins that form Î²-pleated sheets, leading to mechanical compression and inflammation of airways. Often misdiagnosed as refractory asthma or COPD.
